publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-2129 Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of a Gaelic dictionary of parliamentary terms and congratulates the team responsible for producing a resource which will integrate Gaelic more fully into the business of the Parliament. Gu bheil a’ Phàrlamaid a’ cuir fàilte Faclair na Pàrlamaid agus a’ cuir meall a naidheachd air an sgioba riochdachaidh airson goireas a thoirt gu buil a dh’amalaicheas a’ Ghàidhlig nas fheàrr ann an gnothach na Pàrlamaid.

S1M-2129 Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of a Gaelic dictionary of parliamentary terms and congratulates the team responsible for producing a resource which will integrate Gaelic more fully into the business of the Parliament. Gu bheil a’ Phàrlamaid a’ cuir fàilte Faclair na Pàrlamaid agus a’ cuir meall a naidheachd air an sgioba riochdachaidh airson goireas a thoirt gu buil a dh’amalaicheas a’ Ghàidhlig nas fheàrr ann an gnothach na Pàrlamaid.
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Alex Neil*, Nora Radcliffe*, Brian Fitzpatrick*
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Dr Sylvia Jackson*, Christine Grahame*

S1M-2129 Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms-That the Parliament welcomes the publication of a Gaelic dictionary of parliamentary terms and congratulates the team responsible for producing a resource which will integrate Gaelic more fully into the business of the Parliament. Gu bheil a' Phàrlamaid a' cuir fàilte Faclair na Pàrlamaid agus a' cuir meall a naidheachd air an sgioba riochdachaidh airson goireas a thoirt gu buil a dh'amalaicheas a' Ghàidhlig nas fheàrr ann an gnothach na Pàrlamaid. Supported by: Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Brian Fitzpatrick, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie*
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Mr Kenneth Macintosh*, Michael Russell*
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Karen Gillon*

S1M-2129 Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms—That the Parliament welcomes the publication of a Gaelic dictionary of parliamentary terms and congratulates the team responsible for producing a resource which will integrate Gaelic more fully into the business of the Parliament. Gu bheil a’ Phàrlamaid a’ cur fàilte air Faclair na Pàrlamaid agus a’ cur meal-an-naidheachd air an sgioba riochdachaidh airson goireas a thoirt gu buil a dh’amalaicheas a’ Ghàidhlig nas fheàrr ann an gnothach na Pàrlamaid. Supported by: Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Brian Fitzpatrick, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Michael Russell, Karen Gillon
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Rhoda Grant*
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Cathy Peattie*, Pauline McNeill*, Mr Gil Paterson*

S1M-2129 Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms-That the Parliament welcomes the publication of a Gaelic dictionary of parliamentary terms and congratulates the team responsible for producing a resource which will integrate Gaelic more fully into the business of the Parliament. Note: The Member who lodged this motion has provided the following translation - Gu bheil a' Phàrlamaid a' cur fàilte air Faclair na Pàrlamaid agus a' cur meal-an-naidheachd air an sgioba riochdachaidh airson goireas a thoirt gu buil a dh'amalaicheas a' Ghàidhlig nas fheàrr ann an gnothach na Pàrlamaid. Supported by: Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Brian Fitzpatrick, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Michael Russell, Karen Gillon, Rhoda Grant, Cathy Peattie, Pauline McNeill, Mr Gil Paterson
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Roseanna Cunningham*
S1M-2129 Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms (lodged on 24 August 2001) Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-2129 Maureen Macmillan: Gaelic Dictionary of Parliamentary Terms-That the Parliament welcomes the publication of a Gaelic dictionary of parliamentary terms and congratulates the team responsible for producing a resource which will integrate Gaelic more fully into the business of the Parliament. Note: The Member who lodged this motion has provided the following translation - Gu bheil a' Phàrlamaid a' cur fàilte air Faclair na Pàrlamaid agus a' cur meal-an-naidheachd air an sgioba riochdachaidh airson goireas a thoirt gu buil a dh'amalaicheas a' Ghàidhlig nas fheàrr ann an gnothach na Pàrlamaid. Supported by: Alex Neil, Nora Radcliffe, Brian Fitzpatrick, Dr Sylvia Jackson, Christine Grahame, Donald Gorrie, Mr Kenneth Macintosh, Michael Russell, Karen Gillon, Rhoda Grant, Cathy Peattie, Pauline McNeill, Mr Gil Paterson, Roseanna Cunningham, Mr Jamie Stone, Fiona McLeod*
